result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick L Gray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Court would consider early termination of probation after 2 years if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.

No association with any known drug users or dealers.  Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week)  Maintain a valid drivers license.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 12 months of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be completed for each year of probation as directed by Agent.
Stayed, with Huber.  Release for work, work search and treatment.  To be used at the Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick L Gray

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick L Gray in court.  Attorney Timothy T. Kay in court for Derrick L Gray. 
Case called for jury status hearing in 21CF636.
Parties have reached an agreement.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Case 21CF636 is dismissed and read in to this matter.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 Years Imprisonment 
-	3 Years of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 3 Years.  Court would consider early termination of probation after 2 years if all conditions have been met.
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No association with known drug users or dealers;
-	Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	Maintain a valid Driver's License;
-	Complete 20 hours community service for each year of probation

Condition Time: 90 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion 

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 12 months of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:27 AM Defendant Derrick L Gray in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
DDA Boese states that pretrial offer is now revoked, as it was contingent on waiving the prelim.
Attorney Kay states he did not receive the offer.
DDA Boese shows attorney Kay the offer.

The Court recesses at 08:30 AM for attorney Kay to go over the offer with the Defendant.
The Court recalls the matter at 08:51 AM with the same appearances.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Witness fee received from Attorney
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:16 AM Defendant Derrick L Gray in court.  Attorney Kay was previously in court.  Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant states he was in Judge Bohren's courtroom that is why he was late.
The Court quashes the warrant and reinstates bail. 
The Court will set the matter on a date that attorney Kay is in the courthouse. 
ADA Boese states that the date works for the Detective. 
The Court will adjourn the matter.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

EXT CODE 2.
BODY ONLY.

08:45 AM Attorney Timothy T. Kay in court.   Defendant Derrick L Gray did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court admonishes the Defense for being late.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Attorney Kay requests a capias stayed. 
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 2.
BODY ONLY.

ADA Nickolie requests witness costs.
Attorney Kay objects to witness costs being imposed.
The Court will impose $48.00 witness costs by July 05, 2022.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

DA's witness not available - request to adjourn prelim. Sent to CC Costello for review. AS OF 6/3: court's response - Time limits waived, no Marsy's law issue. If no objection by defense, adjourn. If objection, will address on 6/15.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Prelim
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 05-25-2022. "Time limits have been waived and there are no victim's rights/Marsy's Law implications. Request is approved."
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:21 AM Defendant Derrick L Gray in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
